div.l: Now Symond seid þis Iohn by seynte cutbert
Eủer art þᵘou mery and þat ys feyr͗e onswerd
I haue herd sey men̄ schall take of ij thyngꝭes
Such as he fyndeth or such as he bryngeth
But specyally y pᵃray the oste der͗e
Gete us som̄e mete drynke and make us god cher͗e
And we woll pay truly at þe fulle
With Empty handes men̄ may not haukꝭes tulle
Lo heer͗e our͗e syluer Redy for to spend
This myller to the toun̄ his dought̉er send
For ale and bred and Rosted hem a gose
And bond hur horse he schuld no mor͗e go lose
And in his chaumber hem made a bedde
With schetꝭes and Chalons fayr͗e y spredde
Nought from his own̄ bedde x fote or twelue
Hys dought̉er had a bedde all by hur selve
Right in þe same chaumber by and by
Hit myght be no bette and cause why
Ther͗e was no Romer herborou in the plase
They sowpen̄ and they speken̄ hem to solace
And drynken̄ eủer stronge ale at þe best
Aboute mydnyght wente they to reste
Well hath þis myller vernysched his hed
Full pale he was for dronken̄ and nought rede
He yexeth and speketh thorow the nose
As he wer͗e on the quekke or on the pose
To bedde he goth and wᵗith hym his wyf
As any Iay he light was and Iolyf
So was her Ioly whistell well y wette
The cᵃradel at hur beddꝰes feete ys y sette
To Rokke and to yeve the childe sowke
And when̄ þat dronken̄ was all in the crowke
To bedde wente þe doght̉er right anon̄e
To bedde goth Alyn̄ and also Iohn
Then̄ was no mor͗e þeym neded no dwale
This Myller hath so wysely lybbed ale
